Keywords: Hellfire Club , Marauders , Politician , Quiet Council , Ruler , X-Men
Real Name: Sebastian Shaw
Special Powers
KRAKOAN REVIVAL: For all characters with this trait, when a friendly standard character with the X-Men keyword and a lower point value would be KO'd by an opposing effect, you may instead choose to turn that character to it's starting click (this game) and place them adjacent to a friendly character that can use this trait. If you do, your opponent scores that character and generates a bystander on this card (of their choice) adjacent to any of their characters. Your opponent then scores 10 points for every bystander they generated this game via this trait, regardless of source.
KINETIC ENERGY ABSORPTION: When Sebastian Shaw is not on click #11 and takes 2 or more damage from an attack, after resolutions note his current click number and then turn him to click #11. (If he would otherwise be KO'd he can't turn to click #11.) Protected: Pulse Wave, Outwit.
KINETIC ENERGY OVERFLOW: At the end of your turn, or if Sebastian Shaw would be KO'd, return him to the most recently noted click number. Protected: Outwit, Pulse Wave.
Figure Errata
OLD: At the end of your turn or if Sebastian Shaw would be KO'd, return him to the most recently noted click number. Protected: Pulse Wave.
Trade Sebastian Shaw Want Sebastian Shaw

Comments
January 6, 2022
tidge
I just find it unthematic that an opponent can WHOMP!!! him onto that click and then anybody can come along and *plink* him off of it.
January 6, 2022
Battletank
He doesn't need a damage reducer on click 11 because if he gets KOed you put him back on the click he was on before click 11.
December 28, 2021
tidge
The errata definitely improves him. I like that he can't critical-miss himself to KO on his 'Hulk' click... that's happened to me several times with similarly designed characters. For me, the selling point for this versions is the 100-point dial cost, Krakoan Revival and the ability to play nice with X-Men. If I am playing Hellfire Club, I will probably always start with XDPS chase on my team and negotiate down to this one if I need up to 25 more points in the build. The main drawback of this dial as I see it is that there is no guarantee that you will ever be able to make an attack while on click 11, it feels to me like he should have a damage reducer on that click to make up for the clicks of life he has to sacrifice to get there.
September 23, 2021
reanimationguy
Errata just went up for him clarifying his has the X-Men TA and his special defense has Protected: Outwit. I love the prize Shaw, but I’ll have to give this one a go now.
September 17, 2021
jabaka10
I have just started getting back into Clix and I participated in a Draft tonight and was able to pull him. He was left alone for most of the game, I kept in stealth and was able to use Outwit almost constantly, he only started to get targeted when I brought back my first piece with the Krakoan Revival. Yes bystanders are strong, but I one shot them each time they would spawn. It is an interesting concept, it worked well in the draft because they could not really deal with it fast enough and by the time I brought back my first figure it pretty much turned the tide and sealed my wins. I do not know how well it will do in constructed though.
September 16, 2021
SuperClixer
I wish they would of named him Black King. If they are going to remake the Hellfire Club, they should of at least made the main three (Black King (Sebastian Shaw); Black Queen (Selene Gallio); and White King (Donald Pierce), and Lord Imperial, all at the same time.
August 28, 2021
Batcow
For Shaw's defense power, shouldn't that have protected outwit? It makes no sense for his trait to be protected because it can't even be outwitted
August 11, 2021
Goop
This is the perfect example of a figure when facing you just ignore. He's got no move and attack and no range. He gets stronger the further he goes down his dial or whenever he's hit. A smart opponent just wont touch him until they have to. He does have Krokoan revival though but i've seen mixed things about if people want to use it or not since the bystanders are so strong. He's an interesting figure that might be good or trash depending on what opponent does.
